schema.howPerformed: After a brief medical review, you recline in our private suite with heated blankets and noise-cancelling headphones. Our IV specialist inserts a small cannula into a vein in your arm. Your custom-compounded drip (mixed that day based on your needs) flows slowly over 45-60 minutes, delivering vitamins, minerals, amino acids, and antioxidants directly into your bloodstream—bypassing digestion for 100% absorption. We monitor your vital signs throughout. Infusion rate and temperature adjusted for your comfort. You can work, read, meditate, or rest
schema.preparation: Eat a light meal 1-2 hours before (don't come on empty stomach). Stay well-hydrated the day before. Bring recent blood work if available, especially if first visit. Wear comfortable clothing with easy arm access. Avoid alcohol 24 hours before. Come ready to relax and receive
schema.followup: Drink plenty of water after treatment to support kidney function. Avoid alcohol for 24 hours. Most people return to all activities immediately, including exercise. Some drips (especially high-dose vitamin C or NAD+) may cause temporary fatigue—plan light activities that evening. Effects build over 24-48 hours. Follow prescribed oral supplements to extend benefits
schema.outcome: You feel immediately hydrated and refreshed. Mental clarity sharpens within hours as B-vitamins support neurotransmitter production. Energy lifts sustainably without caffeine jitters. Immune system gets armored with vitamin C and zinc. Skin glows as glutathione flushes oxidative stress. Jet lag and burnout symptoms fade. Most people feel dramatically better for 7-14 days. Regular treatments (weekly or monthly) provide cumulative benefits
schema.medicationRequired: None—the IV solution itself contains all therapeutic compounds
schema.treatmentFrequency: Single treatment for acute needs (jet lag, post-illness recovery). Course of 4-6 weekly treatments for chronic fatigue or burnout. Maintenance treatments monthly or quarterly for optimal wellness
schema.adverseOutcome: Mild bruising at cannula site possible. Temporary cool sensation in arm during infusion. Slight mineral taste in mouth during certain formulas (normal). Very rarely: vein irritation, infection (we use strict sterile technique), allergic reaction to specific vitamins
contraindication: Allergy to specific vitamins/minerals in formula
typicalTest: Recent blood work review (kidney function, electrolytes, vitamin levels if available)
Vital signs (blood pressure, heart rate) before starting
Discussion of symptoms and wellness goals

faq.question: Will I need a consultation first for IV therapy?
faq.answer: Yes, new patients enjoy a 20-minute medical review or can share recent blood work so we can tailor the infusion safely to your needs and health status.

faq.question: How much does IV vitamin therapy cost in London?
faq.answer: IV drips start from £275 for basic hydration. Custom formulas range from £350-£600 depending on ingredients. Courses of 4 drips include a discount. Consultation is complimentary.

faq.question: How long does an IV drip take?
faq.answer: Most infusions take 45-60 minutes. NAD+ drips take longer (2-3 hours) due to slower infusion requirements. You can work, read, or rest during the session.

faq.question: Is IV vitamin therapy safe?
faq.answer: Yes, when administered by trained professionals. We use medical-grade vitamins compounded on-site, sterile single-use equipment, and monitor vitals throughout. We screen for contraindications before treatment.

faq.question: How soon will I feel results from IV therapy?
faq.answer: Most people feel immediately hydrated and refreshed. Mental clarity and energy improve within hours to 24 hours. Skin glow and immune benefits develop over days. Effects typically last 7-14 days.

faq.question: Can IV therapy help with jet lag?
faq.answer: Yes—IV hydration with B-vitamins, magnesium, and glutathione is one of the most effective jet lag recovery treatments. Many travelers book sessions before or after long flights.

faq.question: Can IV therapy be combined with weight management?
faq.answer: Absolutely. Many patients pair appetite-regulating medication with weekly drips to maintain hydration, electrolytes, and B-vitamins during weight loss. It helps prevent fatigue and supports metabolism.

faq.question: How often should I book IV therapy?
faq.answer: Frequency depends on your goals. Frequent travelers visit every 7-10 days. Others use IV therapy as a monthly wellness reset or quarterly boost. We design a cadence that fits your schedule and health needs.
